definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Maybe the fork is an opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 也许这把叉子是一个机会。

sentences.english: in the cork workshop, the workers fork the pork.
sentences.chinese: 在栓皮厂房，工许多人用叉子叉猪肉。

sentences.english: Werner put his fork down and raised his coffee cup.
sentences.chinese: 沃纳把叉子放下端起咖啡杯。

sentences.english: My father puts down his fork.
The test consisted of back to back rides the same trails using both forks.
sentences.chinese: 测试构成背对背游戏机相同的路径，使用叉子。

sentences.english: I wanna fock on the table.
Sandy Donovan, 41, eats with a kid-size fork.
sentences.chinese: 四十一岁的珊蒂唐娜芬用小孩用的叉子吃东西。

sentences.english: We use spoons to eat pudding.
sentences.chinese: 用汤勺喝汤，而不用叉子。

sentences.english: Prick potatoes all over with fork, wrap each in aluminum foil, and place on rimmed baking sheet.
sentences.chinese: 用叉子在甘薯上刺洞，用铝箔包裹，放置在烤单边缘。

sentences.english: She uses a fork and she double-dips her egg rolls.
sentences.chinese: 她用的是叉子而且吃蛋皮春卷要蘸两次酱。

sentences.english: We need to buy some salad servers for the party.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要为聚会买些盛沙拉用的叉子和勺子等用具。

sentences.english: Drain the cooked manioc, return to the pan and mash with a potato masher or fork.
sentences.chinese: 排水熟木薯，返回泛醪和一个马铃薯烤至或叉子。

sentences.english: Fork the bales and lift them onto the wagon.
sentences.chinese: 用叉子把草捆挑到马车上去。

sentences.english: You should cut it into pieces and use a fork to get it.
sentences.chinese: 应先将其切成块，再用叉子叉着吃。

sentences.english: Set the dessert forks in a folded napkin on a plate.
sentences.chinese: 将叉子放在口布包里并放在一个盘子上。

sentences.english: We’d use the same fork each time. —Kathy Kniss
sentences.chinese: 我们每次都用同一把叉子。

definition: see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
